description: From bang +â€Ž -er. The sausages were so called because of their excess water content and impervious skin, leading to the risk of explosion if not punctured before cooking.

definitionGroups.group: A thing or person which bangs, in any sense.

entries.meaning: (Britain) A firework that makes a bang.
(sexuality, slang) A person who has sex.
(automotive, slang) An old, worn-out car. From a stereotypical one backfiring, making banging noises.
examples: Synonyms: bucket, beater, hooptie, jalopy, wreck, crock, shitbox, rustbucket; see also Thesaurus:old car

entries.meaning: (US, automotive, slang) A car or an engine; referring to the cylinders of an engine in a car. From the explosive bangs on every cylinder firing.
examples: He drives a little four-banger to work.

entries.meaning: (curling) One of the rocks that end up crashing against another, making banging sounds, after a throw.
(curling) One of the rocks that results in a score at the finish of an end.
(Britain, New Zealand, Australia, food, slang) A sausage.
(US, crime, slang) Clipping of gangbanger; a member of a gang.
examples: Just as the gang peace movement desired to mainstream hardcore bangers into civic society, The Chronic wanted to drive hardcore rap into the popstream.

entries.meaning: (music, slang) A powerfully energetic piece of music, especially dance music.
examples: Morris' melding of influences ranging from mid-'80s computer technology to Baltimore club bangers to the U.K. rave scene has cemented his reputation as one of London's most formidable DJs.

entries.meaning: (slang, by extension) Any particularly good or pleasing thing.
